creator: tzervos@hotmail.com
text:
When HTTP requests don't get served they get a time of 0 milliseconds. Because
of that the average and deviation in the GraphResults diagram change.
When looking at the diagram average and deviation you assume that the
performance of the server is getting better, but actually what is happening is
that the server cannot respond.
I suggest that the GraphResults diagram ignores those events.

creator: tzervos@hotmail.com
text:
Created attachment 3031
A first attempt to fix it. It does work, but there might be better solutions.

As of 1.8, "connection refused" samples have a non-zero time.

Closing as FIXED.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
